titleStmt.title: Joshual F. Bell to Ephraim L. Van Winkle
CWG4641

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Danville 24 Feby 1864
E L Van Winkle Esq
Secy & c
Frankfort Ky
Dear Sir

Have the kindness to have the enclosed petitions from the friend of Yeiser & Grozier presented to the Governor for his usual Signature & either send them to the proper office at Washington or release them to me

The cases presented are meritorious
as was
truly
Yr friend
Joshua F Bell

J James
James
James E Breed
James E Breed
Jam
James
James Wood
James W
James E. Breed
James E. Breed
James E. Breed
James E. Breed

Copy & Send
to Albert Anderson
at "Horse Cave
Hart County Ky,
a copy of the charter
of Horse cave

Send amt offer & direct it to be returned by mail
377
